page.title: 04PUBLIC RECREATION
page.content: Babcary has a fairly large area of about four or five acres reserved for a number of sports. The main sport played is cricket, and there is also an enclosed tennis-court. There is also a small pavillion, which can be used for children when not in use for cricket. On one side of the field there is a small children's playground, consisting of four swings and a mound with concrete piping in it, making three tunnels that meet in the middle. There are two squash-courts at Hazlegrove House and there is a squash-club to which anyone can join. One can play most evenings, and about a hundred people enjoy squash here. The general public can also use Hazlegrove's Sports Hall: badmington, tennis, and also hockey players enjoy the multi-use hall.
